title: Morristown National Historical Park: Accessibility
body: Explore This Park    Plan Your Visit     Accessibility             Accessibility       For People with Mobility Impairments:  The Washington's Headquarters Museum and the Jockey Hollow Visitor Center are fully accessible to wheelchair users Partially accessible bathrooms are located in the Washington's Headquarters Museum and the Jockey Hollow Visitor Center (stalls are wide enough, but doors into the bathrooms are not automatic). The following walkways are paved: from the visitor parking lot into the Washington's Headquarters Museum and from the visitor parking lot into the Jockey Hollow Visitor Center. The Jockey Hollow section of the park has more than 3 miles of paved roads open for touring by private vehicle. Wayside exhibit panels along the route are partially accessible, on paths and in flat, grass covered areas.  For People with Hearing Impairments:  The Washington's Headquarters Museum film has open captions. The Jockey Hollow Visitor Center film has open captions.  For People with Sight Impairments:  The soldier hut exhibit inside the Jockey Hollow Visitor Center has an audio component.
